revised_title: Separation and Analysis of Hydrocarbons in Boghead Coal Distillation
tldr: The author describes a method for separating and analyzing the three classes of hydrocarbons in the volatile portion of boghead coal distillate using bromine and other chemical treatments. The process involves converting naphtha into a heavy oil, separating propyle and benzole, and obtaining aniline and toluidine from the nitro-benzole.
